appendix.title: XML Format
appendix.para:
GoGui uses
Jago's XML format for importing and exporting Go games in XML format. Currently, only files containing a single GoGame element are supported.

The document type definition file as retrieved from
http://www.rene-grothmann.de/jago/Documentation/go.dtd in 10/2007 is included in the GoGui package in src/net/sf/gogui/xml/go.dtd. If a file is read with a DOCTYPE containing go.dtd as a local file, but the local file cannot be found, this copy of go.dtd will be used for validation.
The following list documents how GoGui handles cases in which the documentation for the XML format from the web page and the DTD file are ambiguous or contradicting.

listitem.simpara:
Pass moves are written as move elements with an empty string for the at-property. Handling pass moves this way was first introduced by
GoSVG. Jago has read-support for pass moves since version 5.0.

The XML documentation says that a paragraph element is optional for comments that contain only a single paragraph, but go.dtd requires them. GoGui will always store comments in a paragraph. When reading a file, GoGui can handle the case of direct text in comments, as long its DOCTYPE contains no DTD file or a DTD derived from go.dtd that allows direct text in comments. However mixed text and paragraph elements are not supported.

The XML format contains no support for line-breaks in comments. According to the documentation, paragraphs elements should handle text as the HTML paragraph element. GoGui will replace a line-break by a new paragraph when storing a file. When reading a file, line-breaks and empty lines are trimmed. Other whitespace is never deleted when storing or reading a comment.
